title: Vitamin C vs. Vitamin D: What's more important for your immunity?
author: Timesofindia
description: Vitamin C and Vitamin D, often come up at the top of the list when we discuss the most helpful vitamins for the human body.
cleaned_text: Dec 4, 2020 It's vital to include vitamins and minerals in your diet to stay healthy and fight off diseases.Vitamin C and Vitamin D, often come up at the top of the list when we discuss the most helpful vitamins for the human body. iStock Both Vitamin C and Vitamin D are illness-fighting nutrients, which safeguard our health and boost immunity. iStock We are sure you must have sometime wondered which of these two provides more benefits? And which one keeps infections at bay? iStock While both the vitamins serve their own purposes, individually, too, it's important you not be deficient in any of these. iStock Vitamin C has strong properties which fight free radical damage, get rid of toxins and promote cellular function.It also boosts absorption of other nutrients- including iron, folate, vitamin D, vitamin E and zinc. iStock Vitamin D, on the other hand, strengthens your skin, bones and natural defences.Several studies have supported that vitamin D can help reduce COVID-19 severity. iStock It's easier to find vitamin C foods and sources.Vitamin D, on the other hand, isn't naturally produced by the body. Hence, it's important to not be deficient in Vitamin D. iStock Unlike what many think, Vitamin D does a better job in strengthening your guard against viruses and germs since it is a multi-purposeful nutrient.While Vitamin C is more easily available, it cannot be your sole bet for strengthening immunity. iStock Nutritional guidelines suggest that every adult should have 65-90 milligrams of Vitamin C through various sources every day.Meanwhile, an average daily intake of 400-800 (10-20 mcg) is needed per day to prevent health problems. iStock Thanks For Reading!
